speaker: Dhritarashtra
text: Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, assembled in the holy land of Kurukshetra and desirous of battle, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do?

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: At that time, King Duryodhana, seeing the Pandava army arrayed in military formation, approached his teacher Drona and spoke these words.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: Behold, O master, this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, your wise disciple.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: Here in this army are many heroic bowmen equal in fighting to Bhima and Arjuna; Yuyudhana, Virata, and the mighty warrior Drupada.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: There are also great heroes like Dhrishtaketu, Chekitana, the valiant king of Kashi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja, and Shaibya, the best among men.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: The powerful Yudhamanyu, the brave Uttamauja, the son of Subhadra, and the sons of Draupadiall are mighty warriors.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: O best of the twice-born, let me tell you about the leaders who are especially distinguished on our side. These I mention as the commanders of my army.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: Yourself, Bhishma, Karna, and Kripa, victorious in war; Ashvatthama, Vikarna, and the son of Somadatta.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: And many other heroes also, well-skilled in warfare, equipped with various weapons, all prepared to lay down their lives for me.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: Our army, protected by Bhishma, is unlimited, while theirs, protected by Bhima, is limited.

speaker: Duryodhana
text: Therefore, all of you stationed in your respective positions, support Bhishma alone and protect him on all sides.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: To encourage Duryodhana, the mighty grandsire of the Kuru dynasty, Bhishma, the great valiant warrior, blew his conch loudly like the roar of a lion.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Then all at once, conches, kettledrums, tabors, trumpets, and cow horns blared forth, creating a tumultuous sound.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Then, seated in a grand chariot yoked with white horses, Madhava (Krishna) and the son of Pandu (Arjuna) blew their divine conches.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Hrishikesha blew the Panchajanya; Dhananjaya blew the Devadatta; and Bhima, the voracious eater and doer of terrible deeds, blew the great conch Paundra.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: King Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, blew the Anantavijaya; Nakula and Sahadeva blew the Sughosha and Manipushpaka respectively.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: The excellent archer, the king of Kashi, the great fighter Shikhandi, Dhrishtadyumna, Virata, and the invincible Satyaki.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Drupada, the sons of Draupadi, and the mighty-armed son of Subhadra, O lord of the earth, blew their respective conches.

speaker: Arjuna
text: The tumultuous sound resounded in the sky and on the earth and shattered the hearts of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

speaker: Arjuna
text: At that time, seeing the sons of Dhritarashtra in battle array and taking up his bow, Arjuna, whose flag bore the emblem of Hanuman, spoke the following words to Krishna.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Achyuta (Krishna), please place my chariot between the two armies.

speaker: Arjuna
text: So that I may see those present here, who are desirous of fighting, and who I must contend with in this great battle.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Let me observe those who have come here to fight, wishing to please the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Thus addressed by Arjuna, Hrishikesha (Krishna), O Bharata, placed the magnificent chariot in the midst of the two armies.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: In front of Bhishma, Drona, and all the rulers of the earth, Krishna said, Behold, O Partha, all the Kurus assembled here.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Then Arjuna saw standing there fathers, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, friends,

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Father-in-laws and well-wishersall in both armies. Seeing all these relatives assembled there,

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna was overwhelmed with great compassion and sorrowfully spoke the following words.

speaker: Arjuna
text: My limbs fail, my mouth is parched, my body trembles, and my hair stands on end.

speaker: Arjuna
text: My bow slips from my hand, and my skin burns. I am unable to stand steadily. My mind is reeling.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Krishna, I see adverse omens. I do not foresee any good in killing my own kinsmen in battle.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Krishna, I do not desire victory, kingdom, or pleasures. Of what use is a kingdom, enjoyments, or even life?

speaker: Arjuna
text: Those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments, and pleasuresteachers, fathers, sons, grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law, and other relatives

speaker: Arjuna
text: They are all present here on the battlefield, ready to give up their lives and wealth.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Madhusudana, even if they kill me, I do not wish to kill them, not even for the sovereignty of the three worldshow then for this earth?

speaker: Arjuna
text: What pleasure will we derive from killing the sons of Dhritarashtra? Sin alone will befall us by killing these aggressors.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Therefore, it is not right for us to kill the sons of Dhritarashtra, our own kinsmen. How can we be happy by killing our relatives, O Madhava?

speaker: Arjuna
text: Even though they, with their intelligence clouded by greed, see no wrong in destroying families or hostility to friends,

speaker: Arjuna
text: Why should we, who see the crime in destroying a family, not turn away from this sin?

speaker: Arjuna
text: With the destruction of the family, the eternal family traditions are lost, and as a result, immorality overtakes the whole family.

speaker: Arjuna
text: When irreligion prevails, O Krishna, the women of the family become corrupt, and with the corruption of women, there arises unwanted progeny.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Such unwanted population leads the family and the destroyers of the family to hell; their ancestors fall because the offerings of food and water are stopped.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Due to the sins of those who destroy the family and create such a corrupt population, the traditional duties of caste and family are ruined.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Janardana, we have heard that those whose family duties are destroyed dwell in hell indefinitely.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Alas! How strange that we are prepared to commit a great sin by killing our own kinsmen out of greed for royal pleasures.

speaker: Arjuna
text: It would be better for me if the sons of Dhritarashtra, weapons in hand, killed me in battle while I am unarmed and unresisting.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Thus, speaking on the battlefield, with a mind overwhelmed with sorrow, Arjuna sat down in the chariot, casting aside his bow and arrows.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Seeing Arjuna full of compassion and very sorrowful, his eyes brimming with tears, Madhusudana spoke the following words.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme Lord said: My dear Arjuna, how has this delusion come upon you at this critical moment? It is not befitting a noble person, and it will not lead to heaven, but to infamy.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Do not yield to this unmanliness, O son of Pritha. It does not become you. Give up such petty weakness of heart and arise, O chastiser of the enemy!

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, how can I counterattack Bhishma and Drona with arrows in battle, they who are worthy of my worship?

speaker: Arjuna
text: It is better to live in this world by begging than to live at the cost of the lives of great souls who are my teachers. Though desiring worldly gain, they are superiors. If they are killed, our spoils will be tainted with blood.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Nor do we know which is betterwhether we conquer them or they conquer us. The sons of Dhritarashtra, whom if we kill, we should not care to live, are now standing before us on this battlefield.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Now I am confused about my duty and have lost all composure because of weakness. In this condition, I ask You to tell me clearly what is best for me. I am Your disciple, and I surrender unto You. Please instruct me.

speaker: Arjuna
text: I do not see how any means can relieve the grief which is drying up my senses. Even if I gain an unrivaled and prosperous kingdom on earth or the sovereignty of the gods in heaven.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, Arjuna cast aside his bow and arrows and sat down on the chariot, his mind overwhelmed with sorrow.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: O Bharata, at that time, Krishna, smiling in the midst of both armies, spoke the following words to the grief-stricken Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: You are mourning for what is not worthy of grief, and yet you speak words of wisdom. The wise grieve neither for the living nor the dead.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings; nor in the future shall any of us cease to be.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Just as the boyhood, youth, and old age come to the embodied soul in this body, in the same manner, is the attaining of another body; the wise are not deluded by this.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O son of Kunti, the contact of the senses with sense objects gives rise to cold and heat, pleasure and pain. They come and go, and are impermanent. Endure them bravely, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: That person who is not disturbed by happiness and distress, and is steady in both, becomes eligible for liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are seers of the truth have concluded that of the nonexistent, there is no endurance, and of the eternal, there is no cessation. This they have concluded by studying the nature of both.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Know that which pervades the entire body is indestructible. No one can destroy the imperishable soul.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Only the material body is perishable; the soul is eternal, indestructible, and immeasurable. Therefore, fight, O descendant of Bharata!

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who thinks the soul kills, and he who thinks the soul is killed, are both ignorant. The soul kills not, nor is it killed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: For the soul, there is neither birth nor death at any time. It has not come into being, does not come into being, and will not come into being. It is unborn, eternal, ever-existing, and primeval. It is not slain when the body is slain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Partha, how can a person who knows that the soul is indestructible, eternal, unborn, and immutable kill anyone or cause anyone to kill?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, similarly, the soul accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless ones.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Weapons cannot cut the soul, fire cannot burn it, water cannot wet it, and the wind cannot dry it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This soul is unbreakable and insoluble, and it can be neither burned nor dried. It is eternal, all-pervading, unchangeable, immovable, and ever-present.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: It is said that the soul is invisible, inconceivable, and immutable. Knowing this, you should not grieve for the body.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even if you think that the soul is born and dies constantly, still you have no reason to lament, O mighty-armed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: For one who has taken birth, death is certain, and for one who is dead, birth is certain. Therefore, in this unavoidable situation, you should not lament.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All beings are unmanifest in their beginning, manifest in their interim state, and unmanifest again when annihilated. So what need is there for lamentation?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Some look at the soul as amazing, some describe it as amazing, and some hear of it as amazing, while others, even after hearing about it, cannot understand it at all.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O descendant of Bharata, he who dwells in the body is eternal and can never be slain. Therefore, you should not grieve for any creature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Considering your dharma, you should not waver. For a warrior, there is nothing more honorable than a righteous war.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Partha, happy are the warriors to whom such opportunities come, opening for them the doors of the heavenly realms.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But if you do not engage in this righteous war, then you will fail your duty and lose your reputationand incur sin.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: People will speak of your infamy for all time. And to the honored, infamy is worse than death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The great warriors who have highly esteemed your name will think that you have withdrawn from battle out of fear.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Your enemies will describe you in unkind words and ridicule your ability. What could be more painful than this?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If you are killed, you will attain heaven. If you are victorious, you will enjoy the kingdom on earth. Therefore, arise, O son of Kunti, and be determined to fight.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Treating pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat alike, engage in battle for the sake of duty. Thus you shall not incur sin.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I have explained this knowledge to you through the analytical path of Sankhya. Now listen as I explain the knowledge of yoga. When you act with this understanding, you will be freed from the bondage of karma.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In this endeavor, no effort is ever lost, and there is no harm. Even a little progress on this path protects one from great fear.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those on this path have a resolute purpose. O child of the Kurus, the intelligence of the resolute is single-pointed, but the thoughts of the irresolute are many-branched.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are unwise, delighting in the flowery words of the Vedas, claim that there is nothing else. Their hearts are full of desires, and they seek only heaven.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They speak of various elaborate rites and promise birth as the reward of actions. They desire enjoyment and power and are attracted to heaven.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The intelligence of those attached to pleasure and power, who are drawn away by those words, cannot develop the resolute determination for samadhi.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Vedas deal with the three modes of material nature. Rise above these modes, O Arjuna! Be free from all dualities, always remain balanced, and be established in the Self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All the purposes served by a small well can be served by a great reservoir of water. Similarly, all the purposes of the Vedas are fulfilled to one who knows the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself the cause of the results, and never be attached to inaction.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Be steadfast in yoga, O Arjuna. Perform your duty and abandon all attachment to success or failure. Such evenness of mind is called yoga.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Far inferior is action motivated by desire to action in the state of equanimity. Seek refuge in this even-mindedness. Those who are motivated by fruits are miserable.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person established in yoga discards both good and evil results in this life. Therefore, strive for yoga, for yoga is skill in action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By renouncing the fruits of action, the yogis purify the mind, and attain the eternal abode, free from the bondage of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When your intellect crosses the illusion of delusion, you will become indifferent to all that you have heard and all that is yet to be heard.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When your mind becomes unwavering and fixed in deep meditation, then you will attain divine consciousness.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: What are the signs of one whose mind is steady in wisdom and who is immersed in samadhi? How does such a person speak, sit, and walk?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Lord said: One who gives up all desires of the mind and remains satisfied in the self alone is said to be steady in wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He whose mind is not shaken by sorrow or elated by pleasure, who is free from attachment, fear, and anger, is called a sage of steady wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who remains unattached in all circumstances, who neither rejoices nor hates when he obtains good or evil, is firmly fixed in perfect knowledge.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who can withdraw the senses from their objects, just as a tortoise withdraws its limbs into its shell, is firmly fixed in wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The objects of the senses turn away from a person who abstains from them, but the taste for them remains. Even this taste ceases when one sees the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The senses are so strong and impetuous, O Arjuna, that they can forcibly carry away the mind even of a person of discrimination.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One should control them and bring the mind under the self. Having fixed the mind on Me, one becomes firmly grounded in wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: While contemplating the objects of the senses, a person develops attachment to them. From attachment comes desire, and from desire, anger arises.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: From anger arises delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, the destruction of discrimination; and with the destruction of discrimination, one is lost.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But one who controls the senses and is free from attachment and aversion, even while using the senses, attains tranquility.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In that peace, all sorrows are destroyed. The intellect of such a tranquil person soon becomes steady.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: There is no knowledge for the unsteady, nor is there meditation. Without meditation, there is no peace, and without peace, where is happiness?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Just as a strong wind sweeps away a boat on water, even so, the mind that follows the wandering senses carries away ones intelligence.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, whose senses are withdrawn from their objectshis intelligence is firmly fixed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: What is night for all beings is the time of awakening for the self-controlled; and the time of awakening for all beings is night for the introspective sage.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desiresthat enter like rivers into the ocean, which is ever being filled but is always stillcan alone achieve peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who abandons all desires and acts free from longing, without the sense of I or mine, attains peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This is the state of Brahman. Having attained this, one is not deluded. Being established in this even at the time of death, one attains the Supreme.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Janardana, if knowledge is superior to action, why then do you engage me in this terrible action?

speaker: Arjuna
text: You seem to confuse my intellect with contradictory words. Tell me decisively what is better for me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: In this world, two paths were given by Me long ago  the path of knowledge for the contemplative, and the path of action for the active.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person does not attain freedom from action by merely abstaining from work, nor does he attain perfection by renunciation alone.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: No one can remain inactive even for a moment, for everyone is helplessly driven to action by the qualities born of nature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who restrains the senses and sits with the mind dwelling on sense objects, is a pretender, deluding himself.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But one who controls the senses with the mind, O Arjuna, and engages in Karma Yoga with the organs of action, is superior.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: You should perform your prescribed duty, for action is better than inaction. Even the maintenance of your body is not possible without action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The world is bound by action unless it is done as a sacrifice. Therefore, perform action for that sake and be free from attachment.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In the beginning, the Creator created humans along with sacrifice and said: 'By this shall you prosper; this shall be the giver of all desires.'

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Nourish the gods through sacrifice, and they will nourish you. Thus nourishing one another, you shall attain the highest good.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The gods, nourished by sacrifice, will give you desired objects. But he who enjoys their gifts without offering them is a thief.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The righteous who eat the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins. But the sinful who cook for themselves eat only sin.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All beings are nourished by food, food is produced by rain, rain is produced by sacrifice, and sacrifice is born of action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Know that action arises from the Vedas, and the Vedas arise from the Imperishable. Therefore, the all-pervading Infinite is always present in sacrifice.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who does not follow this wheel set in motion, living in sin, indulging in the senses  he lives in vain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But the one who delights in the Self, is satisfied in the Self, and is content in the Self alone, has no duty.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such a person has no purpose in what he does, nor does he depend on any being for anything.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, perform your duty without attachment. By doing so, one attains the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Indeed, it was by action alone that Janaka and others attained perfection. You should also act for the good of the world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever a great person does, others follow. Whatever standard he sets, the world follows it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: There is nothing for Me to do in all the worlds, nor anything unattained to gain  yet I engage in action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If I did not act carefully, O Partha, people would follow My example in every way.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If I stopped acting, these worlds would perish. I would be the cause of confusion and destruction of all beings.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Just as the ignorant act with attachment, the wise should act without attachment  for the welfare of the world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Let no wise person unsettle the minds of the ignorant who are attached to action. Instead, encourage them by performing duties in the right spirit.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All actions are carried out by the qualities of nature. Deluded by ego, people think, 'I am the doer.'

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But the one who knows the truth understands that it is the qualities acting upon the qualities  and is not attached.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those deluded by the qualities of nature become attached to actions. The wise should not disturb their understanding.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Surrender all actions to Me, with your mind focused on the Self, free from desire and ego  fight, without mental agitation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who follow this teaching with faith and without envy are freed from the bondage of action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those who envy and do not follow this teaching are deluded and ignorant  they are lost.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even a wise person acts according to their own nature. All beings follow their nature. What will restraint accomplish?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Attachment and aversion to sense objects exist. One should not come under their control  they are obstacles.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Better is one's own duty, even if imperfect, than another's duty well-performed. Better to die in one's own duty than follow anothers which brings fear.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: Then what impels a person to sin, even unwillingly, as if by force, O Krishna?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: It is desire, it is anger  born of passion  a great devourer, a great sinner. Know this as the enemy here.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: As fire is covered by smoke, a mirror by dust, and an embryo by the womb, so is wisdom covered by desire.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, wisdom is covered by this eternal enemy of the wise, in the form of desire, the insatiable fire.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The senses, the mind, and the intellect are said to be its seat. Through them, it deludes the embodied being, veiling wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, O best of the Bharatas, restrain the senses and destroy this sinful force, the destroyer of knowledge and wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The senses are higher than the body, the mind is higher than the senses, and the intellect is higher than the mind. But the Self is higher than the intellect.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, knowing the Self to be higher than the intellect, steady the mind with the Self and destroy this enemy  desire, difficult to conquer.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: I taught this imperishable science to Vivasvan, the Sun God; Vivasvan taught it to Manu, the father of mankind; and Manu taught it to Ikshvaku.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This ancient science of the Self has been lost to the world due to long usage, O Bharata. Today, I teach it to you, for you are My devotee and My friend. This secret is the most profound.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you were born after Vivasvan; how then did you teach this science to him in the beginning?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, long ago, I was born and I taught this science to Vivasvan. This is a truth, and I also remember all my past lives. But you do not remember, O scorcher of enemies!

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Although I am unborn and my divine form is imperishable, and although I am the Lord of all beings, yet, by My own divine power, I manifest myself in this world through My Maya.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and a rise in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest Myself on earth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: To protect the righteous, to annihilate the wicked, and to re-establish the principles of dharma, I appear millennium after millennium.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who knows the transcendental nature of My Divine Birth and My activities, does not, upon leaving the body, take his birth again; he comes to Me, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs his duty without attachment, offering the results to Me, is free from sin and reaches the ultimate goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are free from pride and delusion, who have conquered the mind, and who are always absorbed in Me, are free from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All beings in the world are bound by the gunas of nature, but the one who has overcome them, who has transcended the three gunas, is free.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have declared that the ultimate goal of human life is to transcend the material world. But, what about those who perform actions for selfish gain?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The way to transcend material bondage is through devotion to the supreme. Those who seek the Supreme, through this process, are liberated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even the learned transcend the cycle of birth and death through knowledge, but the rest of the world follows the principle of karma, fulfilling their desires.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, the yogis who take refuge in Me and perform their duties with dedication and devotion to the Divine, shall be free from all bondage and reach the goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogis who practice the art of meditation and surrender their actions to the Divine, achieving perfection, are freed from the shackles of the material world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who seek liberation through detachment, abandoning all worldly desires, are capable of performing great works of charity and service.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: It is through the surrender of the ego and renunciation of desire that one achieves the highest goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who perform actions with devotion and without attachment, offering all results to the Divine, are freed from material bondage and attain peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even those who are performing worldly tasks can transcend material bondage if they dedicate their actions to the Divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who dedicate their entire life to the service of the Divine, who are engaged in performing their duties selflessly, shall never experience any negative result.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The wise person offers all actions to the Divine, performing them in a spirit of devotion, and thereby transcends the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is free from the fruits of action and offers them to the Divine, performing without attachment, reaches the ultimate goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Just as a fire burns away all fuel, similarly, the knowledge of the Self burns away all the accumulated effects of past actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who possess this supreme knowledge are free from all desire and attachment, for they have realized their oneness with the Divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The wise who offer their actions to the Divine without attachment are unaffected by the fruits of their actions and live in peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who performs actions for the benefit of others without attachment and with devotion shall be freed from the cycle of rebirth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Performing duties without attachment to the results, the one who surrenders all actions to the Divine attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has renounced all attachments and offers their actions to the Divine attains peace and is freed from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who performs actions selflessly and without attachment is not affected by the consequences, and becomes free from all bondage.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is free from ego and attachment and dedicates all their actions to the Divine shall never be subject to rebirth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who perform their duties selflessly, offering all results to the Divine, are the true yogis and attain peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The knowledge of the Self is the supreme knowledge, which is the key to liberation. Those who possess this knowledge become free from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Seek out the wise and learn from them, by submitting to their guidance and serving them with sincerity. This is the path to attaining the supreme wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When you have obtained this knowledge, you will see all beings in the same light, and be free from the bonds of attachment and ego.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, you can cross over all sins by the boat of knowledge. There is no purifier greater than knowledge.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In this world, there is nothing more powerful and purifying than knowledge. He who has attained knowledge realizes the Self in all beings.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The knowledge of the Self is the key to liberation. It eradicates all doubts and leads one to the realization of the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person who has realized the Self, through the cultivation of knowledge, is freed from the bondage of action and attains the highest state of peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who lack wisdom and knowledge, who are not devoted to the Divine, are bound by the material world and continue to experience the effects of their actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is free from all attachment and desire, who has mastered the knowledge of the Self, transcends the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, O Arjuna, perform your actions with devotion and offer the results to the Divine, for that is the way to liberation.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have praised renunciation of action (sannyasa) and also the performance of action (karma yoga). Tell me decisively which is better.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Renunciation of action (sannyasa) and the performance of action (karma yoga) both lead to liberation, but of the two, the performance of action is superior.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who does not renounce his duties, but performs them with detachment, is superior to the one who simply renounces without understanding the nature of true renunciation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are true renunciates and those who are true yogis are the same. Both act without attachment and are devoted to the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true renunciant is one who is free from desire, attachment, and self-interest. Such a person performs action without being affected by its results.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The true yogi is one who has renounced the fruits of action, and is free from the influence of ego and desires. Such a person is truly free.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is free from attachment and has renounced all desire for worldly gains is a true yogi and will attain liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A yogi is one who has conquered his mind and senses, and is unaffected by the distractions of the material world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has renounced the ego and desires and offers all actions to the Divine is liberated, irrespective of their outward behavior.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who performs actions with a purified mind, without attachment, is free from sin and attains the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who perform actions with a detached mind, offering the results to the Divine, are liberated from all desires and attain liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By performing actions with detachment and surrendering the fruits to the Supreme, the yogi becomes free from the bondage of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has completely surrendered to the Supreme, who has transcended all ego and desires, attains the ultimate state of peace and liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Lord does not take credit for any action or its result. It is the divine will that governs all actions, and thus all actions are performed through the agency of the qualities of nature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are free from desires and are devoted to the Supreme are not affected by the fruits of their actions. They perform all duties with detachment and are unaffected by praise or blame.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi is one who sees all beings equally, and is unaffected by pleasure or pain, success or failure.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who has renounced all desires, and who has attained the state of equanimity, is free from bondage and has attained the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has a pure heart, who has conquered the senses, and who performs actions with devotion to the Divine, will attain liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who has transcended the three gunas (qualities of nature) and is unaffected by them, who is free from desires and ego, attains peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are unaffected by material attachments and who perform their actions with equanimity, have transcended the gunas and are freed from all desires.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The true yogi is the one who is indifferent to the material world and is focused entirely on the Supreme. Such a person lives in peace and freedom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has transcended all desires and is devoted to the Supreme, who performs all actions as an offering to the Divine, is liberated from all bondage.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who have attained true renunciation and yoga are unaffected by the changes of the material world. They are free from the limitations of body and mind.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has established a deep connection with the Divine, who sees the Supreme in all beings, is free from the cycles of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are free from ego and attachment, and who perform actions with the knowledge of the Self, are true yogis and attain liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi is one who sees all beings as equal, who is free from desires and attachments, and who is always absorbed in the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has conquered the mind and senses, who is free from all desires, and who sees the Divine in all beings, is the true yogi.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The true yogi is one who has realized the oneness of all beings, and who sees no distinction between self and others.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has attained this state of consciousness, who is free from ego and attachment, and who sees the Divine in all beings, is liberated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The yogi who performs his duties without attachment, renouncing the fruits of his actions, is superior to the ascetic, the learned, and the self-denying.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The yogi who is steadfast and whose mind is disciplined, who has renounced all material desires and is free from attachment, is a true yogi.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have described the renunciation of actions as the best, and the performance of actions as inferior. But I see a contradiction in your words. Please clarify.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, a true yogi does not renounce actions but renounces attachment to them. He who works with attachment to the fruits of his actions, is far from liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Let a man lift himself by his own efforts, and let him not degrade himself; for the self is the friend of the self, and the self is the enemy of the self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: For him who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends. But for one who has not subdued the mind, the mind is the greatest enemy.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who is detached, with a mind that is steady, and whose senses are under control, can experience the highest bliss.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who is free from envy, who has a tranquil mind, who sees the Self in all beings, and is unaffected by pain and pleasure, is a true yogi.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who considers all beings as his own self, and who is free from attachment, is free from fear and desires.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi is one who is balanced in his thoughts, actions, and emotions. He is free from the distractions of the world and is always absorbed in the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: To practice yoga, one must create a quiet and comfortable place, sit in a firm posture, and practice meditation with a focused mind.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In this practice, one must control the breath and focus the mind on the divine, observing complete discipline over body, mind, and senses.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi should sit in a place that is secluded, free from distractions, and maintain the body in a steady posture to focus the mind.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi should sit with a straight back, regulate the breath, and keep the mind calm, with the focus on the divine. In this state, he is free from all worldly distractions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By practicing such control over the mind and body, a yogi attains inner peace and ultimately realizes the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: A person who eats too much, sleeps too much, or does not eat or sleep enough, is not a true yogi.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi is one who maintains moderation in eating, sleeping, and other habits. He is not attached to material pleasures.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A yogi, who is balanced in his actions, mind, and emotions, is free from desires and enjoys the bliss of peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When the mind is completely controlled and the senses are detached, the yogi attains perfect peace and harmony.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi whose mind is absorbed in the divine, who has mastered control over the senses, attains the highest state of consciousness.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One whose mind is focused on the divine and who experiences the bliss of yoga is unaffected by the distractions of the material world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi, who has gained mastery over his mind, can see the divine presence in all beings and in all situations.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: When the mind is trained in detachment and discipline, it becomes a powerful tool for realizing the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person who practices yoga with complete devotion, renouncing all desires, will attain the state of perfect peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Through the practice of meditation, the yogi can free himself from all desires, and his mind will naturally merge with the divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If the mind wanders away from the focus, the yogi should bring it back with effort and concentration, for it is the mind that controls the self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who is able to control the mind, and who meditates upon the divine with unwavering faith, will experience the highest bliss.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By practicing yoga with devotion, a yogi transcends the material world and attains union with the divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A yogi is one who sees the divine presence in all beings, and who is detached from the material world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who sees the Supreme Lord in all beings, and sees all beings in the Supreme Lord, attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who has attained control over his mind and senses is free from attachment and is devoted to the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: A yogi who practices detachment, who has control over his mind and senses, and who is free from desires, reaches the highest state of peace.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, the mind is restless and difficult to control. How can a person whose mind is disturbed by desires practice yoga?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed, the mind is restless and difficult to control, but through constant practice and detachment, it can be controlled.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: There is no greater difficulty than the control of the restless mind, but through practice and renunciation, one can overcome it.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have said that through practice and detachment, one can control the mind. But the mind is indeed very turbulent and difficult to control.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, the person who makes a sincere attempt, with unwavering faith and practice, will definitely attain perfection, even if they fail initially.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The yogi who has faith and who practices with determination, even if he falls short of perfection, will be born into a noble family in his next life.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such a person is born into a family that is rich in wisdom, and he continues his spiritual journey until he achieves liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who has not attained perfection in this life, but who has made sincere effort, will never fail. He is always guided by divine grace.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, how can one who has made an effort in yoga but has failed, be born into a family that is noble and spiritually rich?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Those who have made sincere efforts in their past lives are always reborn into the best of circumstances, and they continue their journey towards liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The yogi who is devoted to the divine, who has controlled his mind and senses, and who is free from attachment, attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such a yogi, after many lives, attains supreme peace, and will be united with the divine, realizing the highest knowledge.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A true yogi, by meditating upon the divine with a pure heart and mind, is free from all desires and attains the supreme state of peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Among all yogis, the one who worships the divine with devotion and faith is the best, for he has attained the highest state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The yogi who is devoted to the divine, who performs all actions as an offering to the Supreme, is the greatest of all yogis and attains supreme peace.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, listen how by practicing yoga with your mind attached to Me and taking refuge in Me, you will know Me in full, free from doubt.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I shall now declare to you in full this knowledge and wisdom, knowing which nothing more remains to be known in this world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Among thousands of men, one may strive for perfection; and of those who have achieved perfection, hardly one knows Me in truth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and egothese eight are My separated material energies.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Besides this, O mighty-armed Arjuna, there is another superior energy of Mine, which comprises the living entities who are sustaining the universe.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All created beings have their source in these two natures. Of all that is material and spiritual in this world, know for certain that I am both the origin and dissolution.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O conqueror of wealth, there is nothing higher than Me. Everything rests upon Me, like pearls strung on a thread.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O son of Kunti, I am the taste of water, the light of the sun and moon, the sacred syllable Om in the Vedas, the sound in ether, and ability in man.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the sweet fragrance of the earth, and I am the heat in fire. I am the life of all beings, and I am the penance of the ascetics.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, know Me to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent, and the prowess of the powerful.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the strong, I am the strength free from desire and attachment. I am desire that is not contrary to dharma, O best of the Bharatas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All states of beinggoodness, passion, and ignoranceare manifested by My energy. I am, in one sense, everything, but I am independent. I am not under the modes of material nature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Deluded by the three modes (gunas) of nature, the world does not know Me, who am beyond these modes and inexhaustible.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The foolish, the lowest among men, those whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the demonic naturesuch persons do not surrender unto Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Four kinds of virtuous people worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the one who has attained knowledge.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of these, the wise one who is in full knowledge and always engaged in devotional service is the best. I am very dear to him, and he is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All these devotees are certainly magnanimous souls, but he who is situated in knowledge of Me, I consider to be My very self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: After many births and deaths, one who is truly wise surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that is. Such a great soul is very rare.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those whose intelligence has been stolen by desires worship other deities, following particular rules and rituals, compelled by their own natures.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever form a devotee desires to worship with faith, I make that faith steady so that he can devote himself to that form.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Endowed with such faith, he seeks the blessings of that deity and obtains his desires; but in reality, these benefits are given by Me alone.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But the fruits gained by those of small understanding are temporary. Those who worship the demigods go to them, while My devotees come to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The unintelligent think that I, the unmanifest, have become visible. They do not understand My higher nature, which is eternal and supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am never manifest to the foolish and unintelligent. For them, I am covered by My internal potency, and they do not know that I am unborn and infallible.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, I know everything that has happened in the past, everything that is happening in the present, and all that will happen in the future. But Me no one knows.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O scion of Bharata, all living beings are born into delusion, overcome by desire and hatred since birth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But persons who have acted piously in previous lives, and whose sins are completely eradicated, engage in My devotional service with determination.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death take refuge in Me. They fully know Brahman, the individual self, and all actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who know Me as the Supreme Lord of all worlds, as the enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, and as the controller of all beings, understand Me even at the time of death.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the self? What are actions, O Supreme Being? What is material manifestation, and what are the demigods? Please explain this to me.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Who is the Lord of sacrifice, and how does He reside in the body, O Madhusudana? And how can those engaged in devotion know You at the time of death?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: The indestructible, transcendental living entity is called Brahman, and his eternal nature is called the self. Action, pertaining to the development of material bodies, is called karma.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O best of the embodied beings, the physical nature is known to be perishable, and the living entity is called the enjoyer in the body. The Supreme Lord is the controller of all, residing in the body as the overseer.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: And whoever, at the time of death, quits his body remembering Me alone, at once attains My nature. Of this there is no doubt.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever state of being one remembers when he quits his body, that state he will attain without fail.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, Arjuna, you should always think of Me and at the same time perform your prescribed duty. With your mind and intellect fixed on Me, you will certainly come to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who meditates on the Supreme Person with a mind constantly engaged in remembering Me, undeviated by other thoughts, is sure to reach Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One should meditate on the Supreme Person as the one who knows everything, as the oldest, the controller, smaller than the smallest, the maintainer of everything, beyond material conception, inconceivable, and eternal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: At the time of death, with an unshaken mind, devotion, and the strength of yoga, one fixes the life air between the eyebrows and attains the Supreme Person.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I shall now explain to you that path which the yogis take to achieve liberationentering the Brahman, which is eternal and beyond all dualities.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who shuts all the doors of the senses, fixes the mind on the heart, and draws the life air to the top of the head by the power of yoga,

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Chanting the sacred syllable Om, the supreme combination of letters, and leaving the body, one who thinks of Me reaches the supreme goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: For one who always remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O son of Pritha, because of his constant devotion.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: After attaining Me, great souls do not take birth again in this temporary world of misery, because they have reached the highest perfection.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of misery where repeated birth and death occur. But one who reaches My abode never takes birth again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By human calculation, a thousand ages taken together form the duration of Brahmas one day. And such also is the duration of his night.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: At the beginning of Brahmas day, all living beings come into existence; and at night, they are annihilated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Again and again, when Brahmas day arrives, all living entities come into being, and with the arrival of Brahmas night, they are helplessly annihilated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Yet there is another unmanifest nature, which is eternal and is beyond the manifested and unmanifested. It is supreme and never annihilated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: That which the Vedantists describe as unmanifest and imperishablethat is the supreme destination. Those who reach it never return. That is My supreme abode.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O son of Pritha, that Supreme Person is to be attained by unalloyed devotion. In Him all living beings reside, and by Him everything is pervaded.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O best of the Bharatas, I shall now explain to you the different times at which departing, the yogi either returns or does not return.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who know the Supreme Brahman and depart during the time of fire, in light, at an auspicious moment, during the waxing moon, or the six months of the suns northern course, attain the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who depart during the smoke, night, the waning moon, or the six months of the southern course of the sun reach the lunar light and return again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: According to the Vedas, there are two pathsone of light and one of darkness. The one who travels by light does not return; the one who travels by darkness returns.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, knowing these two paths, the yogi is never bewildered. Therefore, be steadfast in devotion at all times.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person who knows the results of both the paths transcends them. Being a devotee, he attains the supreme abode and surpasses all results of Vedic study, sacrifices, austerities, and charities.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: I shall now declare to you, who do not disbelieve, the most confidential knowledge and realization, knowing which you shall be liberated from all miseries of material existence.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This knowledge is the king of education, the most secret of all secrets. It is the purest knowledge, and because it gives direct perception of the self by realization, it is the perfection of religion. It is everlasting and joyfully performed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are not faithful on the path of devotion cannot attain Me, O conqueror of foes. They return to the path of birth and death in this material world.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By Me, in My unmanifested form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: And yet, everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My divine mystery! Although I am the maintainer of all living entities, and although I am everywhere, still My Self is the very source of creation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: As the mighty wind, blowing everywhere, always rests in space, know that similarly, all beings rest in Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O son of Kunti, at the end of the millennium all material manifestations enter into My nature, and at the beginning of another millennium, by My potency, I create them again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The whole cosmic order is under Me. By My will it is manifested again and again, and by My will it is annihilated at the end.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Dhananjaya, these actions do not bind Me. I remain like one unconcerned and unattached to those actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This material nature, which is one of My energies, is working under My direction, producing all moving and non-moving beings. By its rule this manifestation is created and annihilated again and again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Fools deride Me when I descend in the human form. They do not know My transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord of all that be.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are thus bewildered are attracted by demonic and atheistic views. In that deluded condition, their hopes for liberation, their fruitive activities, and their culture of knowledge are all defeated.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But the great souls, who are not deluded, are under the protection of the divine nature. They are fully engaged in devotional service because they know Me as the Supreme Lord, original and inexhaustible.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Always chanting My glories, endeavoring with great determination, bowing down to Me, these great souls perpetually worship Me with devotion.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Others, who engage in the sacrifice of knowledge, worship the Supreme as one without a second, as diverse in many, and in the universal form.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But it is I who am the ritual, the sacrifice, the offering to the ancestors, the healing herb, the transcendental chant. I am the butter and the fire and the offering.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the father of this universe, the mother, the support, and the grandsire. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, and the syllable Om. I am also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the goal, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most dear friend. I am the creation and the annihilation, the basis of everything, the resting place, and the eternal seed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I give heat. I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality and also death. I am both the spirit and matter, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, seeking the heavenly planets, worship Me indirectly. Purified of sin, they take birth on the pious heavenly planet of Indra, where they enjoy godly delights.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When they have thus enjoyed heavenly sense pleasure, they return to this mortal planet again. Thus, through the Vedic principles, they achieve only flickering happiness.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those who always worship Me with exclusive devotion, meditating on My transcendental formto them I carry what they lack, and I preserve what they have.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even those who are devotees of other gods and who worship them with faith actually worship only Me, O son of Kunti, but they do so in a wrong way.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the only enjoyer and master of all sacrifices. Therefore, those who do not recognize My true nature fall down.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who worship the demigods go to the demigods, those who worship ancestors go to the ancestors, those who worship ghosts and spirits go to them, and those who worship Me will live with Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit, or water, I will accept it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerity you performdo that, O son of Kunti, as an offering to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In this way, you will be freed from bondage to work and its auspicious and inauspicious results. With your mind fixed on Me in this principle of renunciation, you will be liberated and come to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I envy no one, nor am I partial to anyone. I am equal to all. But whoever renders service unto Me in devotion is a friend, is in Me, and I am also a friend to him.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even if one commits the most abominable actions, if he is engaged in devotional service, he is to be considered saintly because he is properly situated in his determination.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He quickly becomes righteous and attains lasting peace. O son of Kunti, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O son of Pritha, those who take shelter in Me, though they be of lower birthwomen, Vaishyas, as well as Shudrascan attain the supreme destination.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: How much more so the righteous Brahmanas and the devoted royal sages. Therefore, having come to this temporary, miserable world, engage in My loving service.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me, and offer your homage unto Me. Thus you will come to Me without fail. I promise you this because you are My very dear friend.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna. Because you are dear to Me, I shall speak to you further, imparting knowledge that is supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of all the gods and sages.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, and as the Supreme Lord of the worldshe, undeluded among mortals, is freed from all sins.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Spiritual intelligence, knowledge, freedom from false perception, compassion, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, happieness, unhappiness, birth, death, fear and fearlessness, nonviolence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, infamy; all these varieagated diverse qualities of all living entities originate from Me alone.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The seven great sages and the four ancient Manus, from whom all the creatures of the world have descended, were born from My mind and come forth from Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who truly understands My divine glories and powers is united with Me through unwavering devotionof this there is no doubt.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the source of all creation. Everything proceeds from Me. The wise, who know this, worship Me with loving devotion.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Their thoughts are always on Me, their lives surrendered to Me, they derive satisfaction and bliss from enlightening one another and conversing about Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: To those who are constantly devoted and who worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Light, the Supreme Purifier. All the sages proclaim You as the eternal, divine Person, the original God, unborn and all-pervading.

speaker: Arjuna
text: All that You have said to me, O Krishna, I accept as truth. Neither the gods nor demons comprehend Your true nature.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Indeed, only You know Yourself, by Yourself, O Supreme Person, origin of all beings, Lord of all beings, God of gods, and Master of the universe!

speaker: Arjuna
text: Please tell me in detail of Your divine manifestations, by which You pervade all these worlds.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Krishna, how should I meditate on You? In what forms should I think of You, O Lord?

speaker: Arjuna
text: Tell me again in detail of Your power and glory, for I am never satisfied in hearing Your nectar-like words.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: I shall now declare to you My divine glories, O best of the Kurus. There is no end to My manifestations, but I will tell you the most prominent ones.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the Self, O Arjuna, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the Adityas, I am Vishnu; of lights, I am the radiant sun; of the Maruts, I am Marichi; among the stars, I am the moon.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; of the gods, I am Indra; of the senses, I am the mind; and in living beings, I am consciousness.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the Rudras, I am Shiva; of the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am the lord of wealth, Kubera; of the Vasus, I am Agni; and of mountains, I am Meru.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of priests, O Arjuna, know Me as the chief, Brihaspati; of generals, I am Skanda; of bodies of water, I am the ocean.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the great sages, I am Bhrigu; of words, I am the sacred syllable Om; of sacrifices, I am japa (chanting); and of immovable things, I am the Himalayas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of all trees, I am the banyan; of sages among the gods, I am Narada; of Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; among perfected beings, I am the sage Kapila.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of horses, know Me to be Uchchaihshravas, born of the nectar of immortality; of lordly elephants, I am Airavata; and of men, I am the king.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, I am the wish-fulfilling cow; of causes for procreation, I am Kandarpa, the god of love; and of serpents, I am Vasuki.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of the many-hooded N?gas, I am Ananta; among aquatic beings, I am Varuna; among ancestors, I am Aryama; and among controllers, I am Yama, the lord of death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Among the Daityas, I am Prahlada; among calculators, I am time; among beasts, I am the lion; and among birds, I am Garuda.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Among purifiers, I am the wind; among wielders of weapons, I am Rama; among fish, I am the shark; and among flowing rivers, I am the Ganga.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of all creations, I am the beginning and the end and also the middle. O Arjuna, of all sciences, I am the science of the self, and among logicians, I am the correct reasoning.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of letters, I am the letter A, and among compound words, I am the dual word. I am inexhaustible time, and I am the Creator who faces all directions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am death that carries off all things, and I am the origin of all that shall be. Among women, I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, faithfulness, and patience.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of hymns, I am the Brihat S?ma sung to the Lord; of poetic meters, I am the Gayatri; of months, I am Margashirsha; and of seasons, I am spring.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the gambling of the cheats, the splendor of the splendid, the victory of the victorious, and the resolve of those who are resolute.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Among the Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; among the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among sages, I am Vyasa; and among poets, I am Ushanas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Among punishers, I am the rod of discipline; among those who seek victory, I am morality; among secrets, I am silence; and among the wise, I am wisdom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the seed of all beings. There is no beingmoving or nonmovingthat can exist without Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, there is no end to My divine manifestations. I have merely spoken of the most prominent of My divine glories.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever is glorious, prosperous, or powerful, know that it arises from a fragment of My splendor.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But what need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjuna? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: By Your mercy, I have heard this supreme secret concerning the Self, which You have spoken for my benefit.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard in detail from You about the origin and dissolution of beings, and also Your eternal greatness.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O Supreme Lord, You have spoken about Yourself, but I desire to see Your divine form.

speaker: Arjuna
text: If You think I am capable of seeing it, O Lord of all yoga, then show me Your eternal form.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Behold, O Arjuna, My hundreds and thousands of divine forms, of various colors and shapes.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Behold the Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Ashvins, and Maruts. Behold many wonders never seen before, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Behold now the whole universe, moving and non-moving, gathered together in My body, O Arjuna, and also whatever else you desire to see

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But you cannot see Me with your physical eyes; therefore, I grant you divine eyes. Behold My majestic yoga.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, the great Lord of yoga, Shri Krishna, revealed His supreme form to Arjuna.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: With many mouths and eyes, with many wondrous aspects, with many divine ornaments and weapons raisedHe appeared with celestial garlands and garments, anointed with heavenly fragrances, full of wonders, shining in all directions.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: If a thousand suns were to rise in the sky at once, it might resemble the splendor of that exalted being.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: There, in the body of the God of gods, Arjuna saw the entire universe, divided into many, but united in one.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Filled with awe and wonder, Arjuna, with his hair standing on end, bowed his head and spoke with folded hands.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see all the gods in Your body, as well as various beings, Brahma on His lotus seat, all the sages and the celestial serpents.

speaker: Arjuna
text: I see You with infinite arms, bellies, mouths, and eyeseverywhere without limit. I see no beginning, middle, or end in You, O Lord of the universe.

speaker: Arjuna
text: I see You crowned, armed with a mace and discus, glowing like a blazing fire or the sun, dazzling in all directions.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You are the supreme imperishable, the ultimate resting place of all, the protector of eternal dharma, and the eternal divine being.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You are without beginning, middle, or end, infinite in power, with countless arms; the sun and the moon are Your eyes, and fire is Your mouth, scorching the universe with Your radiance.

speaker: Arjuna
text: The space between heaven and earth, and all the directions, are pervaded by You alone. Seeing this marvelous and terrible form, the three worlds tremble in fear.

speaker: Arjuna
text: All the hosts of gods enter into You; some in fear praise You with folded hands; great sages and perfected beings glorify You with hymns.

speaker: Arjuna
text: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashvins, Maruts, ancestors, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhasall gaze upon You in amazement.

speaker: Arjuna
text: O mighty-armed one, seeing Your great form with many mouths, eyes, arms, thighs, and feet, with many stomachs and terrible teeth, the worlds are terrified, and so am I.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Seeing You touching the sky, glowing with many colors, with gaping mouths and large blazing eyes, my heart trembles and I lose all courage and peace.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Seeing Your terrible mouths, with fearful teeth, I cannot maintain my composure. All directions lose their meaning for me. O Lord of lords, please be gracious!

speaker: Arjuna
text: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with multitudes of kings, Bhishma, Drona, Karna, and the chief warriors of our side tooare all rushing into Your fearsome mouths, with terrible teeth. Some are caught between Your teeth, with heads being crushed.

speaker: Arjuna
text: As many waves of rivers rush toward the ocean, so do these heroes rush into Your blazing mouths.

speaker: Arjuna
text: As moths rush into a blazing fire to perish, so too do these beings rush into Your mouths, only to be destroyed.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You devour all the worlds with Your flaming mouths. You lick them up with blazing tongues. Your fierce radiance fills the universe, burning everything.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You devour all the worlds with Your flaming mouths. You lick them up with blazing tongues. Your fierce radiance fills the universe, burning everything.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: I am Time, the great destroyer of the worlds, and I have come here to destroy all people. Except for you, all the soldiers here on both sides will be slain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, rise up and attain glory! Conquer your enemies and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. I have already slain them; you are but My instrument, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and others have already been killed by Me. You fight and do not fear. You will conquer your enemies.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Hearing these words of Krishna, Arjuna trembled with joined palms, bowed down, and with great fear, spoke to Krishna in a faltering voice.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: Rightly do the world rejoice and glorify You, O Krishna. The demons flee in fear, and the hosts of saints bow to You.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Why should they not bow to You, O Great One? You are greater than Brahma. You are the primal cause. You are the infinite, the abode of the universe, the imperishable and the being beyond both.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You are the primal God, the ancient Purusha. You are the supreme refuge of the universe, the knower and the knowable, and the highest abode. The whole universe is pervaded by You, O infinite form.

speaker: Arjuna
text: You are the wind, death, fire, water, moon, and the creator. I bow to You a thousand times, and again and again I bow to You.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Salutations to You from front, behind, and all sides! O all-powerful One, You are infinite in strength and boundless in valor. You pervade everything and are everything!

speaker: Arjuna
text: Whatever I have said rashly, thinking of You as my friendcalling You Krishna, Yadava, or my companionout of carelessness or love, not knowing Your greatness, and in jestwhile eating, resting, sitting, or playingalone or in companyfor all that, I beg forgiveness, O incomprehensible Lord!

speaker: Arjuna
text: You are the father of the world, the animate and inanimate. You are the object of reverence, the most worthy of worship. There is none equal to You in the three worlds.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Therefore, bowing down and prostrating before You, I seek Your mercy. As a father forgives a son, a friend a friend, a lover his belovedplease forgive me, O Lord.

speaker: Arjuna
text: I am overjoyed to have seen what was never seen before, yet my heart is troubled with fear. Please, O God of gods, show me Your gentle form.

speaker: Arjuna
text: I desire to see You in Your four-armed form, with a crown, holding a mace and a discus. O Lord of a thousand arms, please appear in that form again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Out of My grace, I have shown you this supreme form, radiant, universal, infinite, and primal, which none before you has ever seen.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Neither through the Vedas, nor through austerities, nor through charity or sacrifice, can I be seen in this form in the world of men, as you have seen Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Do not be afraid or bewildered by seeing this terrible form. Be free from fear, and now behold My previous form again.

speaker: Sanjaya
text: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, Krishna appeared in His gentle form again and comforted the terrified Arjuna.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Janardana, seeing this gentle human form of Yours, I am now calm and restored to my own nature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Very difficult it is to behold this form of Mine which you have seen; even the gods always long to see it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Neither by study of the Vedas, nor by austerity, charity, or sacrifice can I be seen in this form as you have seen Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But by undivided devotion alone, I can be truly known, seen, and entered into, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who performs all duties for Me, who considers Me the supreme goal, who is devoted to Me, free from attachment and enmity toward all beingshe truly comes to Me, O Pandava.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: Those devotees who always worship You with devotion, and those who worship the formlesswho among them is better versed in yoga?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me always with steadfast faith, I consider them to be the most perfect in yoga.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those who worship the imperishable, the indefinable, the unmanifest, the all-pervading, the unthinkable, the unchangeable, the immovable, and the eternal

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: controlling all their senses, being even-minded everywhere, engaged in the welfare of all beingsindeed, they too attain Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But the difficulty of those whose minds are set on the unmanifest is greater; for the path of the unmanifest is hard for embodied beings.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those who worship Me, renouncing all actions in Me, considering Me as the supreme goal, meditating on Me with exclusive devotion

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: for them, whose minds are set on Me, I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Fix your mind on Me alone, place your intellect in Me; then surely you will live in Me hereafter.

speaker: Lord Krishna
