text: If you cannot fix your mind steadily on Me, then strive to attain Me through regular practice (abhyasa yoga), O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If you are unable even to practice, then be intent on working for Me. Even by performing actions for My sake, you will attain perfection.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If you cannot do even this, then take refuge in devotion by renouncing the fruits of all actions and acting with self-control.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Better indeed is knowledge than mere practice; better than knowledge is meditation; better than meditation is renunciation of the fruits of actionpeace immediately follows renunciation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who has no hatred for any being, who is friendly and compassionate, who is free from ego, and from ownership, who is patient and content

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: who has a firm resolve, whose mind and intellect are fixed on Me, who is devoted to Mesuch a devotee is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He by whom the world is not agitated, and who is not agitated by the world, who is free from joy, envy, fear, and anxietyhe is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who is free from wants, pure, expert, impartial, and free from anxiety, who renounces all undertakingssuch a devotee is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, who has renounced both good and evil, and is full of devotionhe is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who is the same toward friend and enemy, in honor and dishonor, in cold and heat, in pleasure and pain, who is free from attachment

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: who is indifferent to praise and blame, silent, content with whatever comes, unattached to any place or situation, with a steady mind, full of devotionsuch a devotee is dear to Me.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those devotees who follow this immortal path of devotion, who have faith, and who regard Me as the supreme goalthey are exceedingly dear to Me.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, I desire to understand Prakriti (nature) and Purusha (the spirit), the field and the knower of the field, and also knowledge and that which is to be known.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: O Arjuna, this body is called the "field," and he who knows it is called the "knower of the field" by the wise.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Know Me also as the knower of the field in all fields, O Arjuna. Understanding the field and the knower of the field is true knowledge.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Now hear from Me briefly what the field is, what it is like, what its transformations are, and from where it originates, and also what he is and what his powers are.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Great sages have sung of this in various ways, in different Vedic hymns, and also in well-reasoned and conclusive texts on Brahman.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The field includes the five great elements, ego, intellect, the unmanifest, the ten senses, the mind, and the five sense objects,

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, the aggregate (the body), intelligence, and firmnessthis is the field briefly described with its modifications.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Humility, non-pretentiousness, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadiness, and self-control

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: dispassion towards sense objects, absence of ego, perception of the evil in birth, death, old age, disease, and pain;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: non-attachment, non-identification with son, wife, home, and so on, and constant even-mindedness in desired and undesired events;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: unwavering devotion to Me with exclusive Yoga, resorting to solitary places, disinterest in the company of people;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: constancy in knowledge, perception of the goal of true knowledge: all this is declared to be knowledge, and what is contrary to it is ignorance.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Now I shall declare what is to be known, by knowing which one attains immortality: that is beginningless, the supreme Brahman, called neither being nor non-being.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: It has hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, and ears everywhere. It pervades everything in the universe.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Shining by the functions of all the senses, yet free from all senses; unattached, yet supporting all; without qualities, yet the experiencer of qualities.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Outside and inside all beings, the unmoving and the moving; because of its subtlety, it is incomprehensible; and it is far and near.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Undivided, yet existing as if divided in beings; that is to be known as the sustainer of beings, their absorber and creator as well.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: That light of all lights is said to be beyond darkness; it is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and attainable through knowledge. It is situated in the heart of all.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus the field, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been briefly stated. Knowing this, My devotee becomes fit for My nature.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Know that both Prakriti and Purusha are beginningless; and know also that all modifications and qualities arise from Prakriti.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Prakriti is said to be the cause of the body and the senses; Purusha is said to be the cause of experiencing pleasure and pain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Purusha residing in this body experiences the qualities born of Prakriti. Attachment to the qualities is the cause of birth in good and evil wombs.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme Purusha in this body is called the witness, the consenter, the supporter, the enjoyer, the great Lord, and the Supreme Self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who knows the Purusha and Prakriti with its qualities, in whatever state he may be, he shall never be born again.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Some perceive the Self in the self by meditation, others by the Yoga of knowledge, and others by the Yoga of action.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Still others, not knowing thus, worship by hearing from others; they too cross beyond death, solely by their devotion to what they have heard.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever is born, animate or inanimate, know it to be from the union of the field and the knower of the field, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who sees the Supreme Lord equally existing in all beings, the imperishable in the perishable, truly sees.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Seeing the same Lord equally present everywhere, he does not hurt the Self by the self, and thus attains the supreme goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who sees all actions as performed by Prakriti alone, and the Self as non-doer, truly sees.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When a man sees the diversity of beings as resting in One, and spreading out from it, then he attains Brahman.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: That indestructible Supreme Self, being without beginning and without qualities, though dwelling in the body, does not act, nor is it tainted.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: As the all-pervading space is not tainted because of its subtlety, so the Self, though present in every body, is not tainted.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: As the one sun illumines the entire world, so the Lord of the field illumines the entire field, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who, with the eye of knowledge, perceive the difference between the field and the knower of the field, and the liberation of beings from Prakriti, they attain the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: I shall again declare the supreme knowledge, the best of all knowledge, knowing which all the sages have attained the highest perfection.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Resorting to this knowledge and having attained My state, they are not born at the time of creation, nor are they disturbed at the time of dissolution.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The total material substance, called Brahman, is the womb. In that I place the seed, and from that, O Arjuna, the birth of all beings takes place.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever forms are produced in all the wombs, O son of Kunti, the great Brahman is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Sattva (goodness), Rajas (passion), and Tamas (ignorance)these gunas, born of nature, bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed one.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Of these, Sattva, being pure, illuminating and free from disease, binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Rajas is of the nature of passion, arising from thirst and attachment; it binds the soul by attachment to action, O son of Kunti.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But Tamas, born of ignorance, deludes all embodied beings. It binds through negligence, laziness, and sleep, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Sattva attaches one to happiness, Rajas to action, and Tamas, verily, by covering knowledge, leads to negligence.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: O Arjuna, Sattva arises by overpowering Rajas and Tamas; Rajas arises by overpowering Sattva and Tamas; and Tamas arises by overpowering Sattva and Rajas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When the light of knowledge shines through all the gates of the body, then it may be known that Sattva is predominant.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When greed, activity, undertaking of actions, restlessness, and desire arise, then Rajas is predominant.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When darkness, inactivity, negligence, and delusion arise, then Tamas is predominant.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: If one dies when Sattva is dominant, then he attains the pure worlds of the knowers of the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Dying in Rajas, he is born among those attached to action; dying in Tamas, he is born in the wombs of the deluded.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The fruit of good action is said to be pure and Sattvic; the fruit of Rajas is pain, and ignorance is the fruit of Tamas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: From Sattva arises knowledge; from Rajas, greed arises; and from Tamas arise negligence, delusion, and ignorance.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those established in Sattva rise upwards; those in Rajas remain in the middle; while those in Tamas, engaged in the lowest activities, sink downwards.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When the seer perceives no agent other than the gunas, and knows That which is higher than the gunas, he attains My being.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Having gone beyond these three gunas, which form the body, the embodied one is freed from birth, death, old age, and sorrow, and attains immortality.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: By what signs is he known who has gone beyond the three gunas, O Lord? What is his conduct, and how does he go beyond these three gunas?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: He who does not hate the appearance of light (Sattva), activity (Rajas), and delusion (Tamas), nor longs for them when they disappear;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who remains unattached, unmoved by the gunas, knowing that the gunas operate, and remains firm and undisturbed;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who is alike in pleasure and pain, who dwells in the Self, to whom a clod, a stone, and gold are alike, who is firm-minded, the same in praise and blame;

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The same in honor and dishonor, the same to friend and foe, abandoning all undertakingshe is said to have risen above the gunas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: He who serves Me with unwavering devotion, transcends the gunas and is fit to become Brahman.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: For I am the abode of Brahman, the immortal and imperishable, of eternal Dharma and absolute bliss.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: There is an imperishable tree, the roots of which are above and the branches below; its leaves are the Vedic hymns. One who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Its branches extend down and above, nourished by the three gunas. The roots of this tree are firmly fixed in the ground, and it is said to be eternal. It is the root of all creation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The real form of this tree cannot be perceived in this world. No one can understand where its end is or where its beginning and branches are. But the wise know that this is the eternal tree.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By cutting this tree with the axe of detachment, one should seek the place from which, having departed, one never returns. There, one will find the Supreme Abode, the eternal, imperishable Brahman.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: That supreme reality, which is beyond the material world, is both within and beyond all beings. The one who realizes this supreme truth is liberated from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are free from pride and delusion, who have controlled their senses and attained self-realization, are freed from the bondage of birth and death and attain the Supreme Being.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The divine essence within every living being is an eternal part of Me. Because of this, O Arjuna, all beings are bound to Me, and I am the ultimate cause of all creation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When the individual soul leaves this body and enters another, it carries with it the sense of ego, as the wind carries scents from their sources.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The senses, mind, and intellect are the sources of all experiences. In this body, they create the illusion of separateness. But those who have transcended this illusion are able to perceive the true essence of life.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are attached to the material world are unable to perceive the self, even though it is within them. But those who are free from attachment can perceive the Supreme Self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The soul, which is present in all living beings, is never born, nor does it die. It is eternal and indestructible. When the body is destroyed, the soul remains.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The light of the sun and moon, the power of fire, and the life force in all beings, are all part of My divine energy.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The material nature creates and sustains the physical body, and the soul experiences both pleasure and pain within it. But the soul itself is beyond both pleasure and pain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I am the source of all the senses, and I am also the power that enables them to act. Without My energy, nothing in the material world would exist.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are able to transcend the material world, controlling their senses and intellect, are able to realize the eternal truth and attain liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: There are two types of reality in this world: the perishable, which is the physical body, and the imperishable, which is the soul. The imperishable is beyond the reach of time, and it is indestructible.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme Being is beyond the material creation, beyond both the perishable and imperishable realms. He is the Supreme Reality, the eternal, the unchanging, and the ultimate goal.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme Divine Personality, who is beyond all creation, is the ultimate goal. He is the highest person, the eternal source, and He pervades all beings.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who understands this truththe eternal reality that is the Supreme Beingattains liberation. Having transcended the material world, they are no longer bound by birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: I have explained to you this knowledge of the Supreme Self. Whoever realizes this knowledge and worships the Supreme Being will attain liberation and be freed from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga, generosity, self-restraint, and non-violencethese are the divine qualities, O Arjuna.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Arrogance, pride, hypocrisy, harshness, and ignorancethese are the demoniacal qualities, O son of Pritha.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The divine qualities lead one to liberation, while the demoniacal qualities lead to bondage. Do not grieve, for you are born with divine qualities, O son of Kunti.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The demoniacal person does not know what to do or what not to do. Neither purity, nor good conduct, nor truth is found in them.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They say that the world is unreal, without a god, and that there is nothing beyond the material body. Such deluded souls are caught in doubt and despair.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: These people, who are bound by their desires, perform actions to gratify their senses. They are consumed by their desires and are driven by selfish motives.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such people, being attached to worldly pleasures, do not recognize the higher truth. They reject self-control and disregard the divine path.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: In the pursuit of their desires, they accumulate wealth and perform sacrifices. They act with the sole aim of self-gratification, thinking they are independent of divine laws.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They perform sacrifices for personal gain, without true knowledge or understanding, and are blind to their higher purpose.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The demoniacal soul is always in pursuit of worldly pleasures, not caring for the welfare of others. They disregard the laws of dharma and live only for self-interest.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The demoniacal souls are always filled with greed and desire. Their minds are deluded, and they indulge in actions that bring them suffering and sorrow.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They think, "Today we have acquired such and such a thing; tomorrow we will do this and that." They are driven by ego and the desire to accumulate more wealth, without realizing the impermanence of material life.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They are full of arrogance and disregard for others. They live with a sense of superiority and act in ways that harm others, accumulating negative karmas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Driven by desire, we will fulfill all our goals. No one can stop us; we will enjoy the pleasures of the world forever.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: This is the delusion of the demoniacal soul. They are filled with arrogance and think they are invincible. They reject self-restraint and compassion.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They are envious, malicious, and violent, and they engage in activities that are harmful to others. Their only goal is to attain self-gratification, ignoring the suffering they cause.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They do not believe in any higher reality and instead live in ignorance, bound by their desires. They are deluded by their sense of self-importance and material pleasure.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such people, driven by lust, anger, and greed, destroy their own souls, deluding themselves with the illusion that they are free from all constraints.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: They will be reborn in hell, as they have lived lives of cruelty, violence, and selfishness. They face their own self-created destruction.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The actions of these demoniacal individuals, filled with ego and desire, will lead them to hell, a place of endless suffering, where they will be bound by the consequences of their actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who indulges in passion, anger, and greed shall be born into a lower existence, where their suffering will be greater. This is the fate of those who live according to the demoniacal qualities.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: But those who practice the divine qualities and live in accordance with the supreme truth will attain liberation, and their suffering will cease.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are free from pride, anger, and selfish desire, who follow the path of self-restraint, achieve peace and liberation. They are united with the Supreme Divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, the qualities of the divine and the demoniacal are clearly distinguished. Those who are righteous and practice the divine qualities are blessed, while those who follow the demoniacal path face destruction.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the nature of those who perform acts of worship, but not according to the scriptures? Are they in Sattva, Rajas, or Tamas?

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: According to the three gunas, the faith of the embodied soul is of three kinds. It is in accordance with the nature of the individual; O Arjuna, hear how it is.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Faith in the mode of Sattva is pure, and it is characterized by devotion to the Supreme Being, sincerity, and knowledge of the self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are in the mode of Rajas, driven by desire and attachment, worship the gods of wealth and power. Their actions are motivated by selfishness.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are in the mode of Tamas, who are deluded and ignorant, worship spirits, ghosts, and evil beings. They perform dark rituals and acts of self-harm.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The food that people eat also varies according to the gunas. The pure, sattvic food is nourishing and life-sustaining, giving strength and health.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The rajasik food is bitter, sour, salty, and overly spicy, leading to suffering and agitation, and it is prepared with excessive desire or greed.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The tamasik food is stale, tasteless, decomposed, and putrid. It is food that causes confusion and dullness of mind, leading to negative effects.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: People who are in the mode of Sattva perform actions that are pure and beneficial to all beings, while those in the mode of Rajas perform actions for selfish desires and for the fulfillment of worldly pleasures.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The tamasik person performs harmful acts, with no consideration for others, being motivated by ignorance and cruelty.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: People who are pure in heart and free from attachment perform acts of charity and worship with a sense of selflessness, for the sake of spiritual growth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The rajasik person performs acts of charity expecting something in return, or to gain reputation and power, driven by selfish desire.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The tamasik person performs charity with disdain, not caring for the recipient, and without following any religious principles or expectations.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who practice penance in the mode of Sattva do so with a pure heart, seeking to purify the body and mind, and always with an aim to gain knowledge of the self.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The rajasik person practices penance with self-interest, seeking recognition, or desiring the benefits of the penance, and may harm others while performing it.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The tamasik person performs penance through self-torture, believing that by harming themselves, they will gain some reward. Such penance is contrary to the spirit of true spirituality.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: People who act in the mode of Sattva speak truthfully, kindly, and beneficially, while those in the mode of Rajas speak with deceit, for personal gain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those in Tamas speak harshly, with the intention to hurt others, and their words bring confusion and pain.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are in Sattva worship the Supreme Lord, with devotion, humility, and reverence, and seek the highest truth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The rajasik worship lesser deities, seeking temporary gains or worldly pleasures, and their worship is often driven by desire or ego.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The tamasik person worships spirits, ghosts, or dark forces, seeking harmful or malicious ends, and often engages in superstitious or occult practices.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Such worship, driven by selfishness and ignorance, binds the soul to the cycle of birth and death, as it is not aligned with the highest truth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The threefold faith of the living beings corresponds to the three gunas of nature: sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Whatever worship is done with devotion, and the attitude with which it is performed, determines the nature of the worshiper.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Lord affirms that through faith and devotion, one transcends the influence of the gunas and attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is devoted to the divine worships the Supreme Being, who is free from the influence of the gunas, and transcends the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Therefore, the person who performs actions in accordance with the scriptures, with faith, without selfish desire, and without attachment, transcends the influence of the three gunas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, Arjuna, by knowing the nature of faith, food, penance, and worship, a person can understand their spiritual progress and their alignment with the three gunas.

speaker: Arjuna
text: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have described the renunciation of action (Sannyasa) and the path of selfless action (Karma Yoga). Please clarify the difference between the two, and which is superior.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Blessed Lord said: Renunciation (Sannyasa) and selfless action (Karma Yoga) are both paths to liberation, but one who performs selfless action is superior. Renunciation without action is not the ideal path.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who renounces action because of attachment to the fruits of action, thinking that it leads to liberation, is mistaken. True renunciation is in performing actions selflessly without attachment.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Renunciation, when performed with the right understanding, leads to liberation. This understanding involves recognizing that action must be performed for the sake of duty, without attachment to the results.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Action performed with desire for its fruits is impure, whereas action performed without desire is pure. One should renounce the fruits of action and work for the welfare of others.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The true renunciation of action is not the abandonment of the action itself but the abandonment of attachment to its fruits. One who practices this is not bound by karma.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who is unable to renounce action entirely should perform their duties with detachment and without desire for the fruits, for such actions are free from bondage.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Action performed for the benefit of society, without desire for personal gain, is purifying and leads one closer to liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Actions performed with an attitude of selflessness, without any expectation of reward, are the best path to liberation and are considered the highest form of renunciation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs actions selflessly, without attachment or selfish desire, purifies the mind and attains spiritual progress.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Action is better than inaction, for through inaction, even the maintenance of the body is not possible. Therefore, one should perform actions to fulfill one's duties.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Even when one performs action, it must be done with the understanding that the body and mind are instruments of the Divine, and all results belong to the Divine.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The three gunasSattva, Rajas, and Tamasbind the eternal soul to the body, and thus all actions are influenced by these gunas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The actions of a person, based on the predominance of Sattva, Rajas, or Tamas, vary. A Sattvic person acts with knowledge, Rajasik people act with desires, and Tamasic people act in ignorance.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs actions with a sense of duty, in accordance with their nature, without attachment to the results, remains unaffected by the three gunas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The threefold division of faith, based on the three gunas, leads one to act in ways that affect their spiritual progress.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who is free from pride, whose actions are not influenced by selfish desires, who performs actions with humility, is unaffected by the three gunas.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Selfless action leads to liberation, and this type of action is characterized by detachment from the fruits, by performing one's duties with a sense of service and love.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Actions performed with selfish desires and attachment lead to bondage and suffering, as they keep one entangled in the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Inaction is never the true path to liberation. One must act, but without desire or attachment to the fruits. This is the path of true renunciation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The three gunasSattva, Rajas, and Tamasare responsible for the creation of all beings and the performance of all actions. Understanding this is essential for liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who is affected by Rajas is driven by desires and passion, while the person in Sattva is calm and detached. The Tamasic person is deluded and confused in their actions.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: When one acts with a pure mind, without selfish desires, in accordance with the higher truth, they achieve the state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The fruits of actionwhether good or badare experienced by the doer based on the nature of their actions and desires.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who are attached to worldly desires will be reborn, while those who perform selfless actions are liberated from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who acts without attachment and with a spirit of renunciation, who seeks knowledge, performs their duties with devotion, and leads a life of selfless service, attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The mind, when influenced by the three gunas, can either lead one towards bondage or liberation. By understanding the nature of these gunas, one can transcend them.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The threefold division of faithbased on Sattva, Rajas, and Tamasdetermines the type of worship one follows and the manner in which one practices their spiritual duties.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: A person who is free from attachment to the fruits of their actions, who is steadfast in their devotion to the Supreme, and who lives in accordance with the divine will, experiences the peace of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Selfless action, performed with the right attitude and in the service of others, is the highest path to liberation and spiritual advancement.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has transcended the three gunas and is unaffected by worldly desires is free from suffering and attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The soul is eternal, unaffected by birth, death, or the actions of the body. The Supreme Soul is the ultimate reality, and by meditating upon this truth, one can attain liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs actions with the understanding that they are performing the will of the Supreme, and who is unaffected by the fruits of those actions, attains the highest state of spiritual realization.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The highest form of renunciation is the renunciation of attachment and desire, not the renunciation of action itself. True renunciation involves acting without desire for the fruits.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By renouncing selfish desires and performing one's duties in a selfless manner, one can achieve liberation and transcend the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Actions performed with a sense of duty and detachment, guided by knowledge and wisdom, lead to liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Those who have attained the highest state of self-realization, who live in accordance with the divine will, are liberated and free from the bondage of material existence.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By following the path of selfless action, one attains the Supreme and experiences the ultimate state of peace and bliss.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The highest path to liberation is the path of knowledge, where one sees the divine in all beings, without attachment or selfish desire.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: All actions, whether good or bad, are ultimately governed by the three gunas. By transcending the gunas, one attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who is free from attachment and performs actions in accordance with the divine will is liberated and attains the highest state of spiritual realization.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who has transcended the three gunas, who acts selflessly and lives in accordance with the supreme truth, attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By understanding the nature of the soul and the Supreme, and by performing selfless actions, one can transcend the limitations of the material world and attain the state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Selfless service, devotion to the Supreme, and the renunciation of selfish desires are the paths to spiritual freedom and liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs actions with a sense of duty, without attachment to the fruits, attains liberation and becomes free from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme Self is eternal, beyond the three gunas. By meditating on the Supreme and transcending the three gunas, one attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has transcended the gunas and performs actions in accordance with the Supreme will, without selfish desires, attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The person who performs actions in the service of others, with humility and devotion, attains the highest state of spiritual realization.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who performs selfless actions, guided by wisdom and compassion, becomes free from the limitations of the material world and attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By renouncing attachment to the results of actions and performing them for the greater good, one attains the highest state of spiritual freedom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Through wisdom, devotion, and selfless service, one can overcome the limitations of the material world and attain the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The soul is eternal, unchanging, and unaffected by the actions of the body. By meditating on this truth, one attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By performing actions with a sense of duty and detachment, one can transcend the influence of the three gunas and attain the highest state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has attained the highest state of self-realization, who lives in accordance with the divine will, becomes free from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By following the path of selfless action and devotion to the Supreme, one transcends the limitations of the material world and attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The Supreme is beyond the three gunas, and by meditating on the Supreme and performing actions in accordance with the divine will, one attains the state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By transcending the three gunas and performing actions selflessly, one attains liberation and becomes one with the Supreme.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By constantly meditating on the Supreme and performing selfless actions, one transcends the gunas and attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Selfless actions, performed with devotion and detachment, lead to the highest state of spiritual freedom and liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who has transcended the three gunas and is devoted to the Supreme attains liberation and becomes one with the eternal truth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By meditating on the Supreme and performing actions selflessly, one attains the highest state of spiritual realization.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By surrendering all actions to the Supreme and acting selflessly, one transcends the gunas and attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, having heard this teaching, let the one who is free from attachment act according to the divine will.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Do not be attached to the results of actions and perform them for the sake of others. This will lead to the highest state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Through wisdom, devotion, and selfless service, one can overcome the cycle of birth and death and attain the ultimate liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By transcending the influence of the gunas and acting selflessly, one attains the supreme state of liberation and becomes one with the eternal truth.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who performs actions in service to others, with devotion and humility, attains the highest state of spiritual realization.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who has overcome the gunas and transcended the limitations of the material world becomes one with the Supreme and attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By living according to the divine will and performing selfless actions, one attains the ultimate state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, the path of selfless action, devotion, and renunciation leads one to the supreme truth and liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By living in harmony with the divine will and transcending the three gunas, one attains the highest state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is devoted to the Supreme, who lives in accordance with the divine will, and who performs selfless actions attains liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, the highest state of liberation is attained through selfless action, devotion, and the renunciation of selfish desires.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: One who is devoted to the Supreme, and who acts with humility and selflessness, attains the ultimate state of liberation and spiritual freedom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: By meditating on the Supreme and surrendering all actions to the divine will, one attains the highest state of liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Through selfless service, devotion, and detachment, one transcends the limitations of the material world and attains the ultimate liberation.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: The one who is devoted to the Supreme and who acts with a sense of duty and selflessness attains the highest state of spiritual freedom.

speaker: Lord Krishna
text: Thus, by following the path of selfless action, devotion, and renunciation, one attains liberation and becomes one with the Supreme.
